etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 馬(馬) (mǎ, "horse") = mouth speaks + sound of 'ma' -> question particle
etymology.interpretation: The character 吗(嗎) (ma, "question particle") is used to form yes-no questions in Mandarin. The phonetic component 馬(馬) (mǎ, "horse") suggests the pronunciation, while 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") relates to speaking or sounds.
etymology.simplification: The simplification from 嗎 to 吗 involves replacing 馬(馬) (mǎ, "horse") with its simplified version 马(马) (mǎ, "horse").

examples.chinese: 明天我们去公园吗(明天我們去公園嗎)？
examples.english: Are we going to the park tomorrow?

examples.chinese: 这本书你看过了吗(這本書你看過了嗎)？
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū nǐ kàn guò le ma?
